name: open-remote-distrobox
description: manages vscodium remote extension host for distrobox

commands.title: Connect Current Window to Distrobox Guest
Open a New Window and Connect to Distrobox Guest
Reopen Current Workspace in Guest Distro
Refresh the Distrobox Guest List in Remote Explorer
Create a New Distrobox Guest Container
Clean Up Leftover Files from Previous (Maybe Crashed) Session

distroboxRemoteServer.launch.environment.markdownDescription:
set environment variables for the remote server.

 because the server might be launched through `flatpak-spawn` etc, local environment variables are not guaranteed to be passed to the remote server.

 the values can be a string or `true`. if the value is `true`, it will be queried from `process.env`.

 please note, the schema is set to type `boolean` so the settings UI will display a grid, but only `true` should be used, variables with value `false` will be ignored.

 also note, these variables are set for the remote server using `export` bash commands, the value will be quoted using double quotes, if there are special characters, escape them carefully

^[a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*$.description: the key should be a valid bash variable name, and the value can be a string or `true`. when it's `true`, it is queried from `process.env`

distroboxRemoteServer.download.urlTempla.markdownDescription:
the template of the url to download the remote server, default is vscodium's github releases.

**IMPORTANT**: if the 'product.json' file contains a `serverDownloadUrlTemplate` (e.g. like [this](https://github.com/VSCodium/vscodium/blob/5ca1fc84d377a155d9369b715c04f23e8dbac090/patches/insider/add-remote-url.patch)), this configuration will be ignored.

valid variables are:
- version: in Major.Minor.Patch format, example: 1.98.0
- release: vscodium specific release number, example: 25067
- maybe_release: either `.${release}` or empty, for compatiblilty with pre-1.99
- os: the os name of vscodium builds, example: linux, alpine
- arch: the arch name of vscodium builds, example: x64, arm64
- commit: the git commit hash, example: a73b8210995797cf220f3b0c23690c5747b42447
- quality: either 'stable' or 'insider'

distroboxRemoteServer.install.pathTempla.markdownDescription:
the template of the path where the vscodium remote server will be installed, default is `${serverDataFolderName}/bin/vscodium-reh-${os}-${arch}-${version}${maybe_release}`

all variables in `distroboxRemoteServer.download.urlTemplate` are available too, and an additonal variable is also available:
- serverDataFolderName: where the remote server stores its data, example: `.vscodium-server`, `.vscodium-server-insiders`

**NOTE**: if this path doesn't start with `/`, the home directory $HOME is prepended to it.

**NOTE**: the path to the server command is encoded into the bash script, changes to this setting will not take effect immediately for guests whose control script had already been generated.
